docs.summary:
A [state](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-editor-elements/other-elements/multi-state-boxes/setting-up-your-multi-state-box#navigate-your-states) 
from a [multi-state box]($w.MultiStateBox.html) that can contain other elements.
description: A [state](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-editor-elements/other-elements/multi-state-boxes/setting-up-your-multi-state-box#navigate-your-states) from a [multi-state box]($w.MultiStateBox.html) that can contain other elements.

docs.summary: A property that represents an element's custom CSS classes.
description: > **Note:** This standard element property is not relevant for this State.
> For more information, see [Styling Elements with CSS](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/$w/styling-elements-with-css)
The ID is the state's unique identifier. It is used when selecting
An state's `id` is set in the Editor using the [Properties panel](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-do-i-use-the-properties-panel).

1. [Navigate](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-editor-elements/other-elements/multi-state-boxes/setting-up-your-multi-state-box#navigate-your-states) to the state you want to edit.
1. Edit the STATE ID field in the Properties panel.

examples.title: Get the current state and its ID
